column2: summerluvr2, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: As usual, a medication is unavailable when it works perfectly!  I have been suffering from migraines for 28 years.  I can not take the new class of migraine medications like Imetrex and Zomig due to shortness of breath.  Since it is not available anymore, my doctor prescribed Fioricet, which works just as good as Cafergot.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Cafergot suppositories are back on the market!  In April the manufacturer, G&W Laboratories, Inc., made it available to Walgreens.  I just got my supply after trying many other drug treatments without success.  Check out www.gwlabs.com  Good luck to all of my fellow migraine sufferers!

column2: bodav9@live.com, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: This medicaion has been a blessing to me for 30 ys,I pray we can recieve it again soon. Have tried so many differt ones & had very bad reactions. Please bring Cafergot back!!

column2: sandethayer@aol.com, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I am 66 years old and have experienced debilitating headaches all my life with no effective relief until Cafergot.  I am very upset that I can no longer get it.  If anyone knows where to get it, let me know.

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: It relieves the headache when it starts.

column2: basicjon, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: My cluster headaches have occured on and off for the past 25 years.  Now that caffergot is unavailable, I've experienced headaches more often and more severe.  On a flight home from Chicago, I was ready to open the door and jump out.  If I had been home I would have aske my wife to take me to the emergency room.  Now its back to the doctors office and going through all the old rememdies (verapemil, narcotics, imitrix etc.) which I've already tried with little effect.  My doctor refuses to prescribe it because of the increased risk of heart attack.  I used to take caffergot when taking viagra, since viagra almost always triggers a cluster headache. With caffergot, I pretty much had my headaches under contol.  Now, I'm living in dread of the next hour long headache.

column9: have been using in combination with fioicet for vascular headaches for over 10 years

column2: shelby60, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I began taking this product in 1970.  It has worked for me all these years and nothing else does it.  I take one w/2ibuprofen at onset and in an hour it's gone.  Without this, I am afraid I will be literally disabled. I am frantic to find a generic or the original.  I have never had any negative side effects in all this time. PLEASE release this medicine.  Thousands are depending on it.

column2: TAB, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I am a 64 year old female, having severe migraine headaches since high school.  I never got relief until I was prescribed Cafergot in my 30's. I've taken it for years and can't do without it!

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Has always eliminated the migraine.

column2: Annie, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I am in my 70's and have been taking Cafergot tablets for over 30 years. It works extremely well. Please do NOT discontinue this wonderful & appropriate medication.

column2: suzzz, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I suffered terribly from migraines for about 10 years, trying pill after pill, doctor after doctor, all of which I would just throw up and not get any relief from. I finally went to one doctor who suggested Caforgot in the suppositories, which I immediately was interested because I thought it would not make me throw up! so now its been about 20 years and I am still totally amazed that after using 1/8 of a suppository, my headache is gone in 10 minutes. Its too bad that not many people can take it because if you have any medical problems, you can not use it. It has been a miracle for me. I can cut one suppository into 8 pieces and thats all I need, just 1/8 and rarely need 2 pieces. 1/2 a supp. was way too much and really made me feel like I was "drugged" for about a half hour! Cutting them up really make the cost tolerable too.

I recently returned to Australia to find that I could no longer get Cafergot on prescription from the chemists as they no longer stocked it.I have since found out that you can get Cafergot tablets made here in Australia. There is a company called PCCA who sell the ingredients for Cafergot to certain chemists who then make up the tablets on request. These chemists are called Compounding Chemists. If you log onto the PCCA site (www.pccarx.com) it gives you a telephone number to call (1300 722 269) and they will let you know where your nearest Compounding Chemist is. You do need to have doctors prescription. I had a script for Cafergot plus 5 repeats and was able to get all 120 tablets together from a Compounding Chemist in Lindfield, NSW. They still cost the same as they did in the chemists  120 tablets cost me $120.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I started using cafergot when I was 15 now in my 40 It has worked great for me. I  only have to take one and within 1-2 hrs headache is gone. It does irritate my stomach a little. But I found if I drink plenty of water it helps.  A few years ago I tried one of the newer drugs but it didnt not work as well for me.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: In reply to slf who wrote below that the suppositories are too strong, I suggest that she cuts the suppositories in half.  My doctor told me to keep them in the fridge, and when needed, I cut a suppository in half, wrap the remaining half in foil and return to the fridge.  If you find that is still too strong for you, you could try using 1/3 at a time.  Makes them last longer!  Good luck!

column2: slf, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have taken cafergot tablets for a number of years with good effect. Why discontinue this product. I tried the suppositories but because they were so much stronger ended up with heart palpitations and irreg. heart rate. Be very careful when trying the suppositories. I have no idea how I will manage now without the tablets.

column2: Ange, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have found Cafergot THE ONLY drug that helps get rid of my migraines. I have been taking it for a number of years now and I am DEVASTATED that it is no longer being made. I would love to know why they make the suppositories but not the tablets.

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Works for me but it makes me nauseous.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Further to my comment on 6 January, this morning I woke with the beginning of a migraine and knew that today was the day to trial the Cafergot Suppositories kept in the fridge. Because I usually take 1 tablet (1mg), I cut the 2mg suppository in half, wrapped half in foil and returned to the fridge. Inserted the other half and for about 3/4 hour managed to resist the urge to go to the toilet. My half cafergot suppository worked OK and I now feel well again. Honestly, I would prefer to take Cafergot Tablets, but taking Cafergot Suppositories is preferable to experimenting with other medications. Hope they continue to produce them, or better still, bring back the tablets.

column2: Patricia amole, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Cafergot (ergotamine) more effective than the new drugs such as imitrex.  propranolol and topamax were not effective.  I have taken ergotamine for over 20 years.  ergotamine is cheaper than imitrex.

column2: Robyn H, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been taking cafergot for about 10 years after trying everything else. It gives me instant relief and I don't know what I am going to do if it doesn't come back on the market. I would like to knoe the reason it has been discontinued.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I dread the thought of life without Cafergot Tablets. After suffering Migraine Headaches for years without finding a cure, it was heaven to finally be prescribed Cafergot which I have taken for over 10 years. I take 1 tablet at the onset of a Migraine and now rarely even have to go to bed or vomit like I did previously. On an average I use about 50 tablets per year without any tingling in fingers or feet. Now I can no longer get the Tablets, my Dr just prescribed Suppositories which are still in stock. Have not used them yet. Please start manufacturing the Cafergot Tablets again and put them on the PBS so more sufferers can enjoy their benefits.

column2: angel soulkeeper, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have taken cafergot for over twenty years. It has been the only thing that works. It has now been discontinued in Aust. My whole family suffer from migraines. We all used it. Now we have nothing to help us. Bring it back!

column2: Old Timer, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I am a long term sufferer & on reflection have been badly managed This medication has been superior to anything else. I am concerned now that it has been taken off the market & I don't know how I will manage. Have just tried topamax, and think I would prefer the migraine. Can anyone help or suggest something. I have about a months supply left. It has been suggested that my headaches are "rebound", but whatever, they still need treatmentOld Timer

column2: fran, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have taken cafergot for over 30 years. It is dafe, effective and cheap. I see no reasons to stop it and side effects are much lower than with aspirin.

column2: MT-Nat, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I take this if I run out of Imitrex (which doesn't happen very often).  It seems to alleviate my headaches the same way that Imitrex does if I take it early enough.  But I am careful about taking too much since a Physician's Assistant told me about the moderate to serious side effects.

column2: sleepless, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
flower lady, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I used this drug for 15 or more years without knowing the side effects. Once I went to the ER and saw a new doctor.  He was alarmed to hear how much and how long I had been taking this Cafergot. He was so alarmed, as he had seen the effects of this med. He said you hace already taken too much, don't ever take another Cafergot as long as you live! The side effects he told me about, the way my toes and fingers would feel. Well,that is what I am experiencing. Now is there anybody out there who can identify with me?? Please share with me how you are handling this?I already have some numbness in my toes and a small amt. in my hands.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I suffer from chronic migraines, and this medication has been very effective for me. But as with any prescription med, be very careful with the dosage.  I have been on it for a long time, and have found that after a while, one is not enough, so I need two.  Then I need it more often. That has led to rebound headaches and I have had to "detox" myself from cafergot from time to time. My neurologist works with me,and substitutes a triptan med for me, which though not as effective for me, is also beneficial.  Just be careful when you are taking this medication...watch the dosage.

column1: Headache caused by Disorder of Cranial Blood Vessels
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had to increase the dosage from one pill to 2 at a time

column2: minerangels, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I depend on cafergot to relieve my migraine, so much so that at the onset, my entire family will remind me to take it (since when the pain starts I m a bit disoriented and don't always recognize the signs to be a migraine). I usually lie down in a dark place and pratice relaxing even sleeping if poss after I take it. It works within the hour. I keep an extra few in my purse in case I get stuck at work and a migraine starts. SOmetimes I need two if I have waited to long to take it in the first place or somethmes the migraines just starts out that bad. If after 30 minutes from taking the first pill I do not have at least the edge off, I take another. I swear by cafergot.
